title: Library of Congress Call Numbers: Libraries - Northwestern University
content: The Library of Congress (LC) classification system groups together books on similar subjects by their call numbers. There are 21 main LC call number classifications or classes. Within these, there are also sub-classifications, which are listed on the linked PDFs. Numbers that follow the letters: The numbers define the subject of the book. The number 59 is referring to a book about a specific region or country in this case, America. Cutter Number (the next set of numbers):Â The Cutter Number indicates the author or title of the book. It is taken from a table matching names or titles to a set of numbers. In our example, .T39 reflects the first word of the author, Taylor.
